gcci.text: At an average H100 price of $3.22/hour, hyperscalers must balance aggressive capacity expansion against constrained chip availability and capex exposure, making multi-sourcing and longer-term procurement pivotal for supply assurance.

gtpi.text: With average input pricing at $1.25/1M tokens, providers face margin pressure from API price wars, driving rapid efficiency gains and faster, lighter-weight models to sustain competitiveness.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual data center load imposes significant grid strain and carbon impact, accelerating interest in dispatchable power and nuclear adoption to stabilize reliability and meet decarbonization goals.

aipi.text: Strong capital flows into AI infrastructure are tempered by the need to reconcile high hardware costs with falling token prices, signaling that sustainable growth hinges on improving price-performance and power efficiency.
